cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Tropical Storm (winds 35 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles E of Chetumal, Mexico and 280 miles SSW of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north, move through the Yucatan Channel into the central Gulf of Mexico, strengthen, and then accelerate NE toward the Florida Panhandle; after landfall the system will sweep NE across the Southeast U.S. and exit off the Mid-Atlantic coast before racing offshore toward the NW Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near Apalachicola – Panama City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Cabo Catoche (Mexico) – Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and the Isle of Youth – Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, then the coasts of Alabama, Georgia and the Carolinas before moving offshore of the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Gusty E–SE winds 25–35 mph possible late Friday as the remnant low passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York, NY & NJ
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday into Friday night
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reductions in visibility, minor flooding in poor-drainage areas, and possible short-term berth/terminal operational delays
